qas.question: What percentage of voltage reversal does an AC circuit experience?
What does voltage reversal create in the dielectric of a capacitor?
What percentage of voltage reversal will an under damped DC circuit experience?
What does excess electric field present in the dielectric lead to?

answers.text: heating of both the dielectric and the conductors

qas.question: When designing a capacitor, what is an important rating to consider?
What percentage of voltage reversal does an AC circuit never experience?
What does voltage reversal never create in the dielectric of a capacitor?
What percentage of voltage reversal will an over damped DC circuit experience?
When designing a capacitor, what is an unimportant rating to consider?

plausible_answers.text: heating of both the dielectric and the conductors

qas.question: What does excess electric field not present in the dielectric lead to?

context: For maximum life, capacitors usually need to be able to handle the maximum amount of reversal that a system will experience. An AC circuit will experience <a0_0><b5_0>100% voltage reversal<b5_0/><a0_0/>, while under-damped DC circuits will experience <a2_0><b7_0>less than 100%<b7_0/><a2_0/>. <b8_0>Reversal creates<b8_0/> <a1_0><b6_0>excess electric fields<b6_0/><a1_0/> in the dielectric, causes excess <a3_0><b9_0>heating of both the dielectric and the conductors<b9_0/><a3_0/>, and can dramatically shorten the life expectancy of the capacitor. <a4_0>Reversal ratings<a4_0/> will often affect the design considerations for the capacitor, from the choice of dielectric materials and voltage ratings to the types of internal connections used.
